</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns name of a unit's secondary weapon (empty string if none). </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[secondaryWeapon]] unit </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _secondaryWeapon = [[secondaryWeapon]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[hint]] [[secondaryWeapon]] [[player]]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>"launch_NLAW_F"</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[secondaryWeaponMagazine]], [[secondaryWeaponItems]], [[addSecondaryWeaponItem]]

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 4, 2006 - 10:58
<dt class="note">[[User:Hardrock|hardrock]]
<dd class="note">''Notes from before the conversion:''

[[secondaryWeapon]] tells you what weapon the unit has irrespective of the status of the weapon. For example a unit that has a LAWLauncher on his back will still report a LAWLauncher as its secondary weapon. Use [[currentWeapon]] to detect the active weapon.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
